abstract.shortdesc: Reference list of DITA-OT configuration properties.
abstract.p: The lib/configuration.properties file is used to store configuration properties for DITA-OT and plug-ins. The lib/org.dita.dost.platform/plugin.properties file is used to store configuration properties set by the integration process. The file is regenerated from plug-in configuration each time the integration process is run and should not be edited manually.
The configuration properties are available to both Ant and Java processes, but unlike argument properties, they cannot be set at run-time.

strow.stentry: Default language. Allowed values are those defined in IETF BCP 47, Tags for the Identification of Languages.

Generate xtrf and xtrc debug attributes. Allowed values are
"true" (default) — debug attribute generation is enabled
"false" — debug attribute generation is disabled Disabling debug attributes will reduce the temporary file size and memory consumption. However, log messages will no longer have the source information available and the ability to debug problems may deteriorate.

Error recover mode. Allowed values are
"strict" — enforce strict input validation
"skip" — lax input validation with no error recovery
"lax" (default) — lax input validation and error recovery

FrameMaker index syntax processing. Allowed values are
"true" — FrameMaker index syntax processing
"false" (default) — normal DITA 1.2 index syntax processing

I18N font processing. Allowed values are
"true" (default) — I18N processing is enabled
"false" — I18N processing is disabled

Legacy temporary file mode for generating topic.fo and graphics into output directory. Allowed values are
"true" — use output directory for XSL FO file processing
"false" (default) — use temporary folder for XSL FO processing

reference.title: Integration configuration
reference.abstract: The integration process can be configured using the integrator.properties file.

strow.stentry: A semicolon-separated list of directory paths to search for plug-ins to integrate; relative paths are resolved against the DITA-OT base directory. Any immediate subdirectory containing a "plugin.xml" file is integrated.
A semicolon-separated list of directory names to ignore during plug-in integration.
